actions.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure.

actions.committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Parks, Preservation and Recreation.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Department of the Interior, OMB.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Subcommittee on Parks, Preservation and Recreation. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 105-801.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 629.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Received in the House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee on Resources discharged.
Considered by unanimous consent.
Mr. Hansen asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
On passage Passed without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
By Senator Murkowski from Committee on Energy and Natural Resources filed written report. Report No. 105-405.
Cleared for White House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 105-343.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on National Parks, Historic Preservation and Recreation

official_title: A bill to amend the Act which establised the Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site, in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, by modifying the boundary and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends Federal law to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to acquire and include certain lands owned by the Brookline Conservation Land Trust in the Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site, Massachusetts, to be used for educational and interpretive purposes.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Act which establised the Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site, in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, by modifying the boundary and for other purposes.
